t: Luke 5
The First Disciples
Now*p it happened that while the crowd was pressing around Him and listening to the word of God, He was standing by the lake of Gennesaret;
and He saw two boats lying at the edge of the lake; but the fishermen had gotten out of them and were washing their nets.
And He got into one of the boats, which was Simon’s, and asked him to put out a little way from the land. And He sat down and began*i teaching the people from the boat.
When He had finished speaking, He said to Simon, “Put*r out*r into*r the*r deep*r water*r and*r let*r down*r your*r nets*r for*r a*r catch.”*r
Simon answered and said, “Master, we worked hard all night and caught nothing, but I will do as You say and*i let down the nets.”
When they had done this, they enclosed a great quantity of fish, and their nets began*i to break;
so they signaled to their partners in the other boat for them to come and help them. And they came and filled both of the boats, so that they began to sink.
But when Simon Peter saw that,*i he fell down at Jesus’ feet, saying, “Go away from me Lord, for I am a sinful man!”
For amazement had seized him and all his companions because of the catch of fish which they had taken;
and so also were*i James and John, sons of Zebedee, who were partners with Simon. And Jesus said to Simon, “Do*r not*r fear,*r from*r now*r on*r you*r will*r be*r catching*r men.”*r
When they had brought their boats to land, they left everything and followed Him.
The Leper and the Paralytic

While*p He was in one of the cities, behold, there*i was*i a man covered with leprosy; and when he saw Jesus, he fell on his face and implored Him, saying, “Lord, if You are willing, You can make me clean.”
And He stretched out His hand and touched him, saying, “I*r am*r willing;*r be*r cleansed.”*r And immediately the leprosy left him.

And He ordered him to tell no one, “But*r go*r and*r show*r yourself*r to*r the*r priest*r and*r make*r an*r offering*r for*r your*r cleansing,*r just*r as*r Moses*r commanded,*r as*r a*r testimony*r to*r them.”*r
But the news about Him was spreading even farther, and large crowds were gathering to hear Him*i and to be healed of their sicknesses.
But Jesus Himself would often*i slip away to the wilderness and pray.

One*p day He was teaching; and there were some*i Pharisees and teachers of the law sitting there,*i who had come from every village of Galilee and Judea and from*i Jerusalem; and the power of the Lord was present*i for Him to perform healing.
And some*i men were*i carrying on a bed a man who was paralyzed; and they were trying to bring him in and to set him down in front of Him.
But not finding any way*i to bring him in because of the crowd, they went up on the roof and let him down through the tiles with his stretcher, into the middle of*i the*i crowd,*i in front of Jesus.
Seeing their faith, He said, “Friend,*r your*r sins*r are*r forgiven*r you.”*r
The scribes and the Pharisees began to reason, saying, “Who is this man*i who speaks blasphemies? Who can forgive sins, but God alone?”
But Jesus, aware of their reasonings, answered and said to them, “Why*r are*r you*r reasoning*r in*r your*r hearts?*r
Which*r is*r easier,*r to*r say,*r ‘Your*r sins*r have*r been*r forgiven*r you,’*r or*r to*r say,*r ‘Get*r up*r and*r walk’?*r

But,*r so*r that*r you*r may*r know*r that*r the*r Son*r of*r Man*r has*r authority*r on*r earth*r to*r forgive*r sins,”*r —He said to the paralytic— “I*r say*r to*r you,*r get*r up,*r and*r pick*r up*r your*r stretcher*r and*r go*r home.”*r
Immediately he got up before them, and picked up what he had been lying on, and went home glorifying God.
They were all struck with astonishment and began*i glorifying God; and they were filled with fear, saying, “We have seen remarkable things today.”
Call of Levi (Matthew)
After*p that He went out and noticed a tax collector named Levi sitting in the tax booth, and He said to him, “Follow*r Me.”*r
And he left everything behind, and got up and began*i to follow Him.
And*p Levi gave a big reception for Him in his house; and there was a great crowd of tax collectors and other people*i who were reclining at*i the*i table*i with them.
The Pharisees and their scribes began*i grumbling at His disciples, saying, “Why do you eat and drink with the tax collectors and sinners?”
And Jesus answered and said to them, “It*ir is*ir not*r those*r who*r are*r well*r who*r need*r a*r physician,*r but*r those*r who*r are*r sick.*r
I*r have*r not*r come*r to*r call*r the*r righteous*r but*r sinners*r to*r repentance.”*r
And*p they said to Him, “The disciples of John often fast and offer prayers, the disciples*i of the Pharisees also do the same, but Yours eat and drink.”
And Jesus said to them, “You*r cannot*r make*r the*r attendants*r of*r the*r bridegroom*r fast*r while*r the*r bridegroom*r is*r with*r them,*r can*r you?*r
But*r the*ir days*r will*r come;*r and*r when*r the*r bridegroom*r is*r taken*r away*r from*r them,*r then*r they*r will*r fast*r in*r those*r days.”*r

And He was also telling them a parable: “No*r one*r tears*r a*r piece*r of*r cloth*r from*r a*r new*r garment*r and*r puts*r it*r on*r an*r old*r garment;*r otherwise*r he*r will*r both*r tear*r the*r new,*r and*r the*r piece*r from*r the*r new*r will*r not*r match*r the*r old.*r

And*r no*r one*r puts*r new*r wine*r into*r old*r wineskins;*r otherwise*r the*r new*r wine*r will*r burst*r the*r skins*r and*r it*r will*r be*r spilled*r out,*r and*r the*r skins*r will*r be*r ruined.*r
But*r new*r wine*r must*r be*r put*r into*r fresh*r wineskins.*r
And*r no*r one,*r after*r drinking*r old*r wine*ir wishes*r for*r new;*r for*r he*r says,*r ‘The*r old*r is*r good*r enough.’ ”*ir
